snippet: As a Bergen County school district considers random drug testing of high school students, the argument between some school board members and the public has turned personal.
abstract: Bergen Country, NJ, school district considers random drug testing of high school students, dividing board members and public; those supporting testing point to evidence of rising level of drug use, especially opiates and heroin, among New Jersey teenagers, while opponents say testing creates atmosphere of distrust and oversteps boundaries.
lead_paragraph: As a Bergen County school district considers random drug testing of high school students, the argument between some school board members and the public has turned personal.

headline.main: Drug Testing in Schools Divides North Jersey District
headline.print_headline: Drug Testing in Schools Divides North Jersey District
